abstract: San Francisco 49ers linebacker Chris Borland, one of NFL's top rookies in 2014, is latest player to retire early from sport due to safety concerns regarding head injuries; at 24, he is youngest and most promising of players to call it quits; many veteran players have cited physical toll of football as they retired, but spate of young players leaving is rare.
lead_paragraph: Among the players who have walked away from the N.F.L. this off-season, Borland is the most promising and the most explicit regarding his concerns about head injuries.

headline.main: Chris Borland, Fearing for Health, Retires From the 49ers. At 24.
headline.print_headline: Fearing for His Health, a Star Retires From the 49ers. At 24.

snippet: Among the players who have walked away from the N.F.L. this off-season, Borland is the most promising and the most explicit regarding his concerns about head injuries.
